reviews.text: The rooms are very small, clean but very small. We stayed 2 nights on our arrival in Ho Chi Minh, and as we had no time to find a better location for our return 5 days later we booked 2 night s here on the way back. On our arrival the young man on the front desk said he had no booking for us and no rooms left, however we could see our booking in the book as could the young girl on reception and she pointed it out to him!
reviews.title: Too many problems, better places than this!

reviews.text: He told us we would have to stay at the hotel next door and then come back the next day. We said no. He then said we could have a VIP room, and it would be an extra $12 US a night but he would only charge us $10 US extra a night. We said no. So eventually after 1.5 hours in the early evening we ended up with a VIP room at no extra charge. We should have never taken it, we should have walked out and stayed anywhere else. The next morning we were moved to a smaller room which was no problem.

reviews.text: The biggest problem was when we were checking out!!! Be warned, get your passports in your sights as all of a sudden we were being checked out by that same incompetent young man and he was still fuming from our previous encounter. He tried to charge us for laundry that we never had, then he stalled and spent 20 minutes saying he couldn't get the housekeeper and we would have to pay for the laundry. Then all of a sudden the housekeeper appears and says it is not our laundry it is on the wrong room number. Safe we think, NO! The housekeeper rings down to say that we had broken a glass in the room, we confirmed that yes the water glass in the bathroom had been broken. Well until we paid $1.00 we would not be given our passports. With a taxi waiting to take us to the airport, no passports being handed over, the $1.00 was paid while we were harrassed by this young man telling us that if everyone that stayed there broke their glassses they would have no money! Oh dear, in my 50 years travelling on this earth I have never been asked to pay for a broken glass or treated so disrespectfully.
Stay anywhere but here! You have been well and truly warned.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay with Lac Vien for three nights at the end of our trip to Vietnam. The hotel is in the backpacker's area of Saigon, but was had a very sophisticated feel and looked much nicer than most of the accommodations in the area. Another plus was that it is located down a small alley from most of the nightlife, so it was very quiet at night. The price was very reasonable for a standard room with double occupancy. It was an easy walk to the Ben Than Market and many nearby restaurants and tour companies. It was a more lengthy walk, but we walked to all the major tourist attractions without any real problem (Reunification Palace, War Remnants, etc.). We also booked a tour to the Cu Chi tunnels and Cao Dai Temple for a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Great Experience With Lac Vien

reviews.text: All in all, we had a really great experience at Lac Vien and would recommend the hotel to any tourist traveling through Saigon.
